channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15122] Servlets generate XSS_REQUEST_PARAMETER_TO_SERVLET_WRITER findbugs warnings
item.description:
In our JMXJsonServlet we are doing this:

jsonpcb = request.getParameter(CALLBACK_PARAM);
if (jsonpcb != null) {
response.setContentType("application/javascript; charset=utf8");
writer.write(jsonpcb + "(");

...

Findbugs complains rightly. There are other instances in our servlets and then there are the pages generated by jamon excluded from findbugs checking (and findbugs volunteers that it is dumb in this regard finding only the most egregious of violations).

We have no sanitizing tooling in hbase that I know of (correct me if I am wrong). I started to pull on this thread and it runs deep. Our Jamon templating (last updated in 2013 and before that, in 2011) engine doesn't seem to have sanitizing means either and there seems to be outstanding XSS complaint against jamon that goes unaddressed.

Could pull in something like https://www.owasp.org/index.php/OWASP_Java_Encoder_Project and run all emissions via it or get a templating engine that has sanitizing built in.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: make a patch.

Excellent. I like the way you add tooling so we can address this stuff going forward.

Andrew Purtell (or Sean Busbey/Enis Soztutar) Any input? We are probably susceptible in a million places. This is the one place found by FB. It says that if it is finding XSS, then very likely there is much more to be found (other tooling that looks for XSS will turn up instances. Our templating system is dumb (and old). Has no facility for sanitizing against XSS. Failing that, this lib introduced in this patch gives us ammo going forward.

-1 overall

I was trying to test this patch but after running mvn -DskipTests clean package assembly:single i see this:


[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-remote-resources-plugin:1.5:process (default) on project hbase-assembly: Error rendering velocity resource. Error invoking method 'get(java.lang.Integer)' in java.util.ArrayList at META-INF/NOTICE.vm[line 275, column 22]: InvocationTargetException: Index: 0, Size: 0 -> [Help 1]

Based on HBASE-14199 we need to update supplemental-models.
Samir Ahmic, what branch are you attempting to build on? Can you turn on the debug license output and see what dependency changed? It'll be the last one listed in the LICENSE file.

Witch module LICENSE file should i check ?

I was able to successfully build master adding commons-beanutils-core, and xalan dependencies in supplemental-models. Here is diff


diff --git a/hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml b/hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

index 2f94226..357a9e3 100644

--- a/hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

+++ b/hbase-resource-bundle/src/main/resources/supplemental-models.xml

@@ -61,6 +61,42 @@ under the License.

       </licenses>

     </project>

   </supplement>

+  <supplement>

+    <project>

+      <groupId>commons-beanutils</groupId>

+      <artifactId>commons-beanutils-core</artifactId>

+

+      <organization>

+        <name>The Apache Software Foundation</name>

+      </organization>

+          <distribution>repo</distribution>

+        </license>

+      </licenses>

+    </project>

+          <distribution>repo</distribution>

+        </license>

+      </licenses>

+    </project> 

+  </supplement>

 <!-- Artifacts with ambiguously named licenses in POM -->

   <supplement>

     <project>

Is this acceptable solution Sean Busbey ?

sorry I missed your earlier comment. Looks like we need to move our debug stuff from LICENSE to NOTICE, if that file is getting generated first.

Both of those additions look fine. Were those dependencies brought in by this change or some other change? If they were brought in by some other change, we should probably handle that change in a different jira.

Here is relevant part of mvn dependency:tree -Dverbose:


[INFO] +- org.owasp.esapi:esapi:jar:2.1.0:compile

----------> [INFO] |  |  \- xalan:xalan:jar:2.7.0:compile

Both of those dependencies are introduced by this jira as compile dependencies of OWAS ESAPI java project.

Good digging Samir Ahmic

Do we need an update on the patch then?

yep, if this adds the dependencies then it also needs to include any needed license fixes. I thought in prior tickets we had decided to avoid adding the OWASP implementations (Elliott Clark do you recall? I seem to recall you were the initial objection)

I'm concerned about the Xerces reference. We generally want to avoid bringing in Xerces (because it's a notorious pain on java classpaths). It's not your issue if something else brought it in, but we (the project) should figure out when/how that came in and if we can avoid it.
Here is patch for master branch with addition to supplemental-models.xml.
Sorry for rushing with patch. I was planing to use ESAPI to address some issues find by scanning our webapp with OWAS ZAP.
I'd be interested in objections to OWASP. If not this tooling, what would folks suggest. There are more than this single instance of findbugs XSS to squash and a bit of tooling would be appreciated.

I think it was just specific to the prior case. In that case it was a simple filter for adding an HTTP header to avoid framing our UI. This seems sufficiently more advanced to be worth it.

Is there a more up to date version of the ESAPI that avoids the inclusion of Xerces? Presuming I can find the other place it's bleeding in, I'd really like to avoid it.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Xerces was listed in the dependency tree that Samir Ahmic posted.

As I can see on master branch Xerces dependency was introduces before this patch with hadoop-hdfs-2.7.1. Here is relevant part of dependency tree:


[INFO] org.apache.hbase:hbase-server:jar:2.0.0-SNAPSHOT

[INFO] +- org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-hdfs:jar:2.7.1:compile

[INFO] |  \- xerces:xercesImpl:jar:2.9.1:compile

[INFO] \- org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-hdfs:test-jar:tests:2.7.1:test

[INFO]    \- (xerces:xercesImpl:jar:2.9.1:test - omitted for duplicate)

okay. I'm going ot make a ticket to exclude Xerces from our hadoop dependency (they have it for some offline image editor or similar thing we don't need).

Can someone see if ESAPI can avoid it?
I can add exclusion for ESAPI and check how things will look like.
You'll have to make sure it's not still getting pulled in via e.g. the hadoop dependency

Here is new patch excluding Xerces dependency for OWAS ESAPI. I have tested patch by building master branch against hadoop-2.5.2 which does not include any Xerces references. So i have successfully run TestJMXJsonServlet and build project without any Xerces dependency.
